html: A #PBM is hired by insurance companies to serve as middleman between the consumer & the drug company. They negotiate prices and create lists of preferred drugs that determine how much patients pay. PBMs state that they keep prices low.pic.twitter.com/3hvRNcdDo0

html: First and foremost, #EqualPay is an issue of equal rights. But it's more than that. Closing the #WageGap is also about families, fairness, and economics. Equal pay for equal work will build a more just economy and put more money in the pockets of working families.
text:
First and foremost, #EqualPay is an issue of equal rights. But it's more than that.

Closing the #WageGap is also about families, fairness, and economics. Equal pay for equal work will build a more just economy and put more money in the pockets of working families.

html: Latinas have to work through 2018 & until Nov 2019 to earn what white men earned in 2018 alone. It’s time to close the #WageGap for ALL women and end this injustice. #EqualPayDay

html: Breaking the cycle of poverty IS possible—and we need to make laws that value families. The #AmericanFamilyAct is a HUGE step for families and children in New Jersey.
text: Breaking the cycle of poverty IS possible—and we need to make laws that value families. The #AmericanFamilyAct is a HUGE step for families and children in New Jersey.

html: The #AmericanFamilyAct reforms the Child Tax Credit to reflect the challenges parents face in this economy: For children under 6: Increased to $300/mo to help pay for strollers, diapers, daycare, etc. For children 6-16: Increased to $250/mo to help make ends meet
text:
The #AmericanFamilyAct reforms the Child Tax Credit to reflect the challenges parents face in this economy:
 For children under 6: Increased to $300/mo to help pay for strollers, diapers, daycare, etc.
 For children 6-16: Increased to $250/mo to help make ends meet

html: Raising a child today is more expensive than ever and 15% of children in America are growing up in poverty—a cycle that is hard to break. That’s why I’m co-sponsoring the #AmericanFamilyAct, which could cut the child poverty rate by nearly half.
text:
Raising a child today is more expensive than ever and 15% of children in America are growing up in poverty—a cycle that is hard to break.

That’s why I’m co-sponsoring the #AmericanFamilyAct, which could cut the child poverty rate by nearly half.

html: I’m proud to announce that @USCG approved our request and it’s now in effect, giving riders some peace of mind. As we work towards completing the #PortalBridge and #Gateway, this is a MAJOR step to ensure our commuters can get to work and home safely and without disruption.
text:
I’m proud to announce that @USCG approved our request and it’s now in effect, giving riders some peace of mind.

As we work towards completing the #PortalBridge and #Gateway, this is a MAJOR step to ensure our commuters can get to work and home safely and without disruption.

html: Every time the 108-year old Portal Bridge fails, the disruptions spread across our transportation system faster than the plague. @SenBooker, @GovMurphy, and I asked @USCG to restrict marine traffic on the Hackensack River during rush hours in order to prevent this.
text: Every time the 108-year old Portal Bridge fails, the disruptions spread across our transportation system faster than the plague. @SenBooker, @GovMurphy, and I asked @USCG to restrict marine traffic on the Hackensack River during rush hours in order to prevent this.

html: In #Eritrea, Aster Fissehatsion has been held incommunicado without charge or trial since September 2001. Her whereabouts, 17 years later, are still not known. She was arrested together with 10 other members of a group of political dissidents known as the Group of 15.
text: In #Eritrea, Aster Fissehatsion has been held incommunicado without charge or trial since September 2001. Her whereabouts, 17 years later, are still not known. She was arrested together with 10 other members of a group of political dissidents known as the Group of 15.

html: #China has also targeted Tibetan #Buddhist nuns. The government expelled thousands of nuns from Larung Gar in Sichuan. Their homes were demolished; they were barred from entering other monasteries, and faced detention, harassment and abuse. #IWD19
text: #China has also targeted Tibetan #Buddhist nuns. The government expelled thousands of nuns from Larung Gar in Sichuan. Their homes were demolished; they were barred from entering other monasteries, and faced detention, harassment and abuse. #IWD19

html: #China is responsible for some of the worst #humanrights abuses, including the imprisonment of #Uighur women in detention camps. These women are forced to renounce their Muslim religion and Uighur language. Forced labor, torture and death are common. #IWD19

html: In #Egypt, Hanan Badr el-Din, a human rights defender and co-founder of the Families of the Forcibly Disappeared Association, was detained on May 6, 2017 at Qanatar prison while visiting an individual who had been forcibly disappeared. #IWD19

text:
Violence against bus drivers & train operators not only threatens workers, but everyone else on board.

Our legislation requires transit agencies to:
Collaborate w/ workers on a risk reduction plan
Create a plan to implement goals
Report data on assaults to @DatabaseTransitpic.twitter.com/xv56mi51t0

 Threat of physical violence
 Risk of traffic crashes

html: Progress has been made, but we are a long way from fair and equitable representation. While most big corporations claim #CorporateDiversity is a core value, our bill establishes transparency to track this progress.
text: Progress has been made, but we are a long way from fair and equitable representation. While most big corporations claim #CorporateDiversity is a core value, our bill establishes transparency to track this progress.

html: Same goes with people of color. Companies should represent their consumers—and their consumers are not exclusively white males. Fair representation of women & minorities in corporate boardrooms & C-suite executive positions is not only good for business, but for our country.pic.twitter.com/lytbKYZvZP
text:
Same goes with people of color. Companies should represent their consumers—and their consumers are not exclusively white males.

Fair representation of women & minorities in corporate boardrooms & C-suite executive positions is not only good for business, but for our country.pic.twitter.com/lytbKYZvZP

html: For those with Type 1 diabetes, insulin is literally a matter of life or death. But we’ve only seen the cost go up—nearly doubling in the past 5 years. When Kathy’s son started picking up his insulin himself, he saw the price tag—$1,700/month—and rationed his prescription.
text: For those with Type 1 diabetes, insulin is literally a matter of life or death. But we’ve only seen the cost go up—nearly doubling in the past 5 years.  When Kathy’s son started picking up his insulin himself, he saw the price tag—$1,700/month—and rationed his prescription.
